# GitHub Repository Setup Guide

This guide will help you make your repository stand out on GitHub.

## 1. Repository Description

Add this description to your repository:
```
A powerful RAG tool that scrapes YouTube channel videos, extracts transcripts, and enables AI-powered chat interactions using Google's Gemini API.
```

## 2. Topics/Tags

Go to your repository → Click the gear icon (⚙️) next to "About" → Add these topics:

**Primary Topics:**
- youtube-scraper
- rag
- retrieval-augmented-generation
- gemini-api
- youtube-transcripts
- ai-chatbot
- python
- apify
- youtube-api
- ai-search

**Secondary Topics:**
- machine-learning
- natural-language-processing
- video-analysis
- content-analysis
- terminal-ui
- markdown
- cli-tool
- video-transcription
- ai-assistant

## 3. Repository Website (Optional)

If you have a demo or documentation site, add the URL in the "Website" field.

## 4. Social Preview Image

Add a custom social preview image (1280x640px recommended) to make your repository stand out in social media shares.

## 5. README Badges

The README already includes badges. Make sure they work by:
- Updating the LICENSE link if your license file is in a different location
- Verifying all external links are correct

## 6. Pin Important Repositories

If this is one of your main projects, pin it to your GitHub profile.

## 7. Add Screenshots (Recommended)

Add a `screenshots/` folder with:
- Terminal output showing the chat interface
- Example queries and responses
- Project structure visualization

Then add them to your README:

```markdown
## Screenshots

![Chat Interface](screenshots/chat-interface.png)
![Example Query](screenshots/example-query.png)
```

## 8. GitHub Actions (Optional)

Consider adding:
- CI/CD pipeline for testing
- Code quality checks
- Automated dependency updates

## 9. Contributing Guidelines

The README includes a Contributing section. Consider creating a `CONTRIBUTING.md` file with detailed guidelines.

## 10. Code of Conduct (Optional)

Add a `CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md` for open source best practices.

## Quick Checklist

- [ ] Repository description added
- [ ] Topics/tags added
- [ ] README is complete and in English
- [ ] LICENSE file exists
- [ ] Issue templates are set up (already created)
- [ ] .gitignore is configured
- [ ] All badges in README work correctly
- [ ] Screenshots added (optional but recommended)
- [ ] Repository is public (if you want it discoverable)

## Additional Tips

1. **Keep README Updated**: Update README when you add new features
2. **Use Clear Commit Messages**: Good commit messages help others understand changes
3. **Add Releases**: Create releases for major versions
4. **Respond to Issues**: Active maintenance shows the project is alive
5. **Add Examples**: Include more usage examples in README
